    "in this paper we study the additive numerical semigroup in @xmath5 generated by a finite set of positive integers @xmath6 and the arrangement of the set of the integers which are unrepresentable by @xmath7 .",
    "such integers are also known as the _ gaps _ of the numerical semigroup .",
    "first , recall the main known facts @xcite .",
    "semigroup @xmath8 , @xmath9 is said to be generated by the minimal set of @xmath10 natural numbers @xmath11 , if there are no nonnegative integers @xmath12 for which the following linear dependence holds : @xmath13 and @xmath14 .",

    "there are many known results on the med ",

    "the inequality ( [ ar27 ] ) coincides with inequality ( [ ar24a ] ) in the case @xmath297 .    the other corollary deals with the cardinalities of sets @xmath357 and @xmath358 .",
    "[ cor7]@xmath64 + let a numerical semigroup @xmath338 be given .",
    "then @xmath359    proof @xmath67by theorem [ the8 ] the numerical semigroup @xmath353 is nonsymmetric , and therefore @xmath360 is nonempty .",
    "equating both cardinalities @xmath361 and @xmath362 given in ( [ ar25r ] ) we get ( [ ar26 ] ) .",
    "vice versa , if ( [ ar26 ] ) does hold for the med ",
    "semigroup then by comparison with ( [ ar25r ] ) we get @xmath363.@xmath77    by consequence of ( [ ar26 ] ) , in the case @xmath297 equality ( [ ar26a ] ) occurs iff @xmath364    we finish this section with one example for the 5-dim numerical med  semigroup .",
    "the polynomial @xmath54 was obtained by means of diagrammatic calculation on the set @xmath27 .",
    "@xmath365[ex3 ] @xmath366 @xmath367      in this section we apply our results of section [ p4 ] to another special kind of numerical semigroups , making use of important theorem @xcite on the structure of numerical semigroups . recall remark [ re0 ] on the number of nongaps of a semigroup .",
    "( @xcite , theorem 20)[the9 ] + let @xmath20 be a semigroup of type @xmath368 and let @xmath369 be the number of elements in @xmath20 which are less than @xmath34",
    ". then we have @xmath370    notice that ( [ bu1 ] ) together with ( [ tr8 ] ) and ( [ tr9 ] ) is equivalent to @xmath371\\;.\\label{intro7}\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] call the two extreme cases in ( [ intro7 ] ) _ semigroups of maximal length _ ( ml ) ,",
    "when @xmath372 attains its maximal value , and _ semigroups of minimal length _",
    "( _ ml _ ) , when @xmath373 vanishes .",
    "the latter case corresponds exactly to symmetric semigroups .",
    "( @xcite , theorem 1 ; @xcite , corollary at p. 339)[the10 ] + let @xmath20 be a numerical semigroup of type @xmath374 . then @xmath375 has maximal length iff @xmath376    when @xmath372 gets an intermediate values in the interval @xmath377\\right)$ ] , semigroup @xmath378 can be generated by sophisticated series of generators , similar to ( [ intro8a ] ) , or by a significant number of sporadic tuples @xcite . in the meantime , the study of numerical semigroups with generic length are far from its completeness .",
    "call @xmath20 _ semigroup of almost minimal length _",
    "( _ aml _ ) or _ almost maximal length _ ( aml ) if it has , respectively , @xmath379 - 1\\;. \\label{intro8b}\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] the semigroups of almost minimal length were discussed in section [ s1p5 ] . as for the semigroups of",
    "almost maximal length , several explicit results are known :    ( @xcite , proposition at p. 345)[lem4 ] + let @xmath380 be a numerical semigroup of almost maximal length and @xmath381 its type . then either @xmath382    ( @xcite , theorem 3)[the11 ] + let @xmath20 be a numerical semigroup of type @xmath383 .",
    "then @xmath380 has almost maximal length iff its generating tuple @xmath384 is one of the following : @xmath385    ( @xcite , theorem 5 ; @xcite , corollary 2 ) [ the12 ] + let @xmath20 be a numerical semigroup of type @xmath386",
    ". then @xmath380 has almost maximal length iff @xmath387    we obtain two corollaries on the semigroups of maximal and almost maximal length respectively .",
    "[ cor8]@xmath64 + the numerical semigroups @xmath375 satisfy @xmath388    proof @xmath67by theorem [ the10 ] any ml  semigroup is a med  semigroup ; therefore , according to ( [ ar24 ] ) and ( [ ar25 ] ) , we arrive at ( [ intro10]).@xmath77    by consequence of ( [ intro10 ] ) , there exists only one ml ",
    "semigroup with @xmath389 which is pseudo  symmetric , @xmath390 .    note that the aml ",
    "semigroup @xmath391 in theorem [ the11 ] is also a med  semigroup , @xmath392 while the other sporadic aml  semigroups ( [ intro9a ] ) with @xmath393 are not med ",
    "semigroups , @xmath394    [ cor9]@xmath64 + any semigroup of almost maximal length @xmath380 with @xmath395 satisfies @xmath396    proof @xmath67 by theorem [ the12 ] the @xmath380semigroup with @xmath395 is the med ",
    "semigroup , and therefore , according to ( [ ar24 ] ) and ( [ ar25 ] ) , we arrive at ( [ intro12]).@xmath77    by consequence of ( [ intro11 ] ) and ( [ intro12 ] ) , we get the known result @xcite : there exists only one aml pseudo  symmetric semigroup , @xmath397 .",
    "the paper has been written during the stay of one of the authors ( lgf ) at the mathematics section of the abdus salam international centre for theoretical physics ( ictp ) and its hospitality is highly appreciated .",
    "the other author ( fa ) is grateful to v. i. arnold for having introduced her to the frobenius problem during his stay at ictp .",

    ". j. math , * 89 * , 1073 ( 1967 ) e. miller and b. sturmfels , _ combinatorial commutative algebra _ ,",
    "+ new york : springer , 2005 , p. 45",

    "macaulay local rings of maximal embedding dimensions _ ,",
    "+ j. algebra , * 56 * , 168 ( 1979 )"
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> there exist two different sorts of gaps in the nonsymmetric numerical additive semigroups finitely generated by a minimal set of positive integers @xmath0 . </S>",
    "<S> the @xmath1gaps are specific only for the nonsymmetric semigroups while the @xmath2gaps are possessed by both , symmetric and nonsymmetric semigroups . </S>",
    "<S> we derive the generating functions for the corresponding sets of gaps , @xmath3 and @xmath4 , and prove several statements on the minimal and maximal values of the @xmath1gaps . </S>",
    "<S> detailed description of both sorts of gaps is given for three special kinds of nonsymmetric semigroups : semigroups with maximal embedding dimension , semigroups of maximal and almost maximal length , and pseudo  symmetric semigroups . </S>",
    "<S> +   + keywords : nonsymmetric and symmetric semigroups , frobenius problem . </S>",
    "<S> +   + 2000 mathematics subject classification : primary  20m14 , secondary  11p81 . </S>"
  ]
}
